transcript.content: [BLANK_AUDIO].
[SOUND].
The house will come to order,
members will take their seats, visitors
will retire from the chamber,
the sergeant-at-arms will close the
doors.
I ask all members and all guests to please silence any electronic
devices.
This morning's prayer will be offered by Representative Whitmire,
we'd ask all members and all visitors to please stand for the prayer
and remain standing for the pledge of allegiance.
Representative Whitmire.
>> Thank you as you find your seats,
before I pray I wanna share
two verses.
From Isaiah 66:2 It says,
this is the one I esteem, he who is humble
and contract in the spirit and trembles at my word,
and from first
1 Peter 5:5, all of you cloth yourselves with humility,
towards
one another because God opposes the proud but gives grace to the
humble.
May we pray.
Dear heavenly father,
Father, thank you for many blessings and please forgive us of our
sins as we perceive down he home stretch of this 2016 short session
we ask that you help us to humble and carrying in our decision
making.
So that the decisions we make that dictate the outcome of immense
amounts of money and very important policy decision we do it receptive
of your guidance and ion your will so that we ultimately do what's
best for our districts our state and our nation.
In Christ name I pray amen.
>> Amen I pledge allegiance to the flag of United States of America
and to the republic on which it stands one nation under God indivisible
with liberty and justice for all.
>> The gentleman from Harnett Representative Louis is recognized
for a motion.
>> Mr speaker the journal for Tuesday June 21st has been examined
and found to be correct I move that it stands approved as
written.
>> Representative Louis moves that the journal for June 21st be
approved as written those in favor will say aye.
>> Aye.
Those opposed no, the ayes have it the journal is approved as written.
Ratification of bills and resolutions the clerk will read.
>> The enrolling clerk [INAUDIBLE] the following bills to be ratified
for presentation to the governor.
House bill 464 an act to So it just compensates for board of trustees
the reason transportation authorities to oblige that all members
of the board of trustees shall be voting members to authorise regional
transportation authorities to hire a Chief Administrative Officer
and to clarify the voting process by members of the Board of Trustees
Regional Transportation Authorities [UNKNOWN] Presentation to the
office of the Secretary of State.
House Bill 956, An act providing that Henderson County is authorised
to construct community college buildings on the campus of Blue
Ridge Community College

noted

Thank you.

thank

where

active

would you please senator

five marshall officers to clarify

>> The gentleman's recognised for a motion.
Just a moment

Members I do make a motion that we do concur with the Senate Senate

and if I may Mr.
Speaker explain the bill.
>> The gentleman is recognized to debate the motion.
>> Members this is a firefighter's feel good bill and it comes to
us with the full support from the Insurance Commissioner,
The Fireman's
Fire fighters association,
in section one of the Bill, that adds
the word changes the definition to include our county fire marshals
the assistant fire marshals,
deputy fire marshals to the definition.
And so, Section two the word fire man has been changed to fire fighter
so we can include the females because we do have a lot of females
who are fire fighters as well giving those individuals the recognition
as a fire fighter as well,
Section three that addresses the fire
fighters fund, which basically talks about the membership and how
that membership will be identified for that fund.
Section four, again it changes the definition from fire man to fire
fighters.
And again section five,
Talks about a local relief fund board and the make up of that board
which is five members and section six,
discuss, i'm sorry let me
go section seven it talks about the rating when false alarms,
or
alarms that aren't un intentional have been initiated those will
not affect the rating that are in place at this time.
Basically a technical Bill I certainly appreciate your support.

>> I move to concur with the Senate committee substitute House Bill
>> Gentleman has moved that the House do concur with House Bill
667, the gentleman has the floor to debate the motion.
>> Thank you Mr.
Speaker, members of the house.
This is actually House language in a House Bill substituted in by
the Senate which is kinda unusual.
So this bill is some clean up and further refinement of regulations
in the penalties and remedies within facilities so we've worked
This out with the department,
with the facilities and with the patient
advocates as far as I know everybody is on board with these fixes
and changes and the modernization.
The other piece that's on here is a bill that has run through his
house several times removing the Sunset on the waiver for electronic
supervision for Grandfather Mountain,
a home for children and for
Barium Springs so the bill,
Representative Jordan, and Turner,
and Dobson are on that bill.
We've Hopefully finally we'll resolve this issue so unless somebody
has some questions we can refer those to any detail questions to
Representative Dobson/g but I appreciate your support.
>> What purpose does the gentleman from Durham Representative Hall
rise?
>> I have a question,
For the Bill sponsor or.
>> Does the gentleman from Wake yield for the gentleman from Durham?
>> I yield.
>> He yields.
>> Thank you Mr.
Speaker and either for Representative [UNKNOWN] or whoever else

surveillance that's being done,
it was previously, Sun setting
and I just wanna clarify this,
does this mean that going forward
now this is state wide and those standards will be adopted and
enforced state wide?
>> No sir, what this does,
this pilot has been underway for more
than 10 years most of the time that I've been,
Here in the legislature
and Senator Hoil/g I think was the one who originated the Bill,
it just involves those two facilities we had it at Grandfathered
Mountain, it has really helped the safety and security of those
young children at night and when Barium Springs,
Which is also nationally known as well,
when those two merged, what
we did last year was extend this waiver to both facilities and
now we're just removing the sun set but all of the protections
that we have had in there from the beginning for the department
time [UNKNOWN]comes up will,
Will still be there so all the protections
in reviews will continue to be on going to make sure that it continues
to operate and provide the safety for the children that it was
intended to do originally.
>> For what purpose does h e gentleman from [UNKNOWN] Representative,
Rise?

I mean
totally changing them we send this Bill to the Senate,
it was athletic
trainer health coverage option and it comes back a totally different
Bill.
Those things happen.
>> [LAUGH]
>> Follow up.
>> The gentleman is recognized for a follow up.
>> I guess I just wanted to make the comment that it's happening
more and more often and there's a whole bunch of them that are
coming up that have been totally changed that we're gonna have

>> Thank you Mr.
speaker, the bill went over and what we actually start is a simple
agency there that went over to the senate with a few amendments
which we made and those amendments have been
moved around all day and we'd like to take that in conference and
talk about some of those as well as there's a major issue that
will be added to the bill hopefully and if you recognize representative
[INAUDIBLE] he will speak to that major issue.
>> For what purpose does the gentleman from Gastrin representative
Representative [INAUDIBLE] arise.
>> Speaking on the motion Mr.
speaker.
>> The gentleman is recognized to debate the motion.
>> All the ladies and gentleman of the house this as Representative
Baylor so properly put it is there's nothing really of concern
of the current language within 959 I think was the number,
everything
has moved, we've met with our senator counterparts,
we all agree
on the language that is It's currently in,
the reason we're not
concurring is to add a piece of language that you all need to be
made aware of.
As you know, we have had some news about Map Act and how North Carolina
in the last year went about capturing people's property for roads
that was the
Wrong way to do that.
This body understood it was a wrong way to do that.
So we have to address it for further out.
So I wanna let you know that when the Bill comes back from conference
a section will be added and Mr.
Speaker if I need staff,
I have them available if that would be
appropriate, if there's any questions.
When the Bill comes back,
we'll have the Map Act, language in that
Bill, here's some key points.
You can go home and say that the current operational format and
procedures under the Map Act are no more,
they're gone.
It provides one year for NCDOT to look at ad decide a path,
Forward,
okay, it also takes into consideration those impacted from a monetary
situation, we do not have real numbers but we set a path forward
as to what to do.
We're also instructing DOT to address maps in three phases,
ones
that are complete, ones that are
In process and ones that are future,
so when we could bring the
Bill back, we will go into more specific detail on those but I
wanted to let everyone know that when it comes back it will have
a Map Act which is very substantial forward moving legislation
on how we address public and private property when it comes to
building roads.
And we're available for any questions Mr.
Speaker.

would that not be subject to an objection

>> The gentleman is recognized for further inquiry
>> Would it then
not
Be better procedure to send this to the appropriate subject matter

the bill
will then at that point go to the subject matter committee.
There's no procedure to because the only other way that that will
be addressed would be if the chair would have name the entire committee
as a conference committee and the chair doesn't believe that that's
gonna be an efficient use of time,
so let the chair thank the gentleman
for his question.
